page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This Domeday Survey block is in the far west corner of Greater London.Most of it lies within the Borough of Hillingdon. The block is divided into two distinct halves by the M 4 Motorway which takes traffic from London to the West of the country. North of the motorway lies the busy town of West Drayton, often congested with traffic making its way to and from Heathrow Airport just south of the block. South of the M 4 lie the quiet villages of Harmondsworth and Sipson. Gravel extraction is the major industry of this area, while farming is still of great importance. Transport is a major theme. The new M 25 motorway will be open in late 1985 to add to the M 4, the Great Western Railway and the edge of Heathrow airport - all in the block.
